TopicTitle: Cannot force AA on KSP using OpenGL

Articles.Content:
Here we go with another thread from me, this time, my modded install is all working perfectly, except for one last problem, i cannot get the AA to come on when using the -force-opengl command, i have tried forcing it through the control panel, i have tried turning it off in game when using the Nvidia control panel option. I am all out of idea's. Help please!

Edited January 16, 2015 by SmashBrown

Still hoping someone can help me out with this.

- - - Updated - - -

Fixed, FINALLY. Using opengl with -pupupwindow, and pressing alt+enter when the game loads up to put it into windowed mode gives me back AA.

Hello SmashBrown,

thanks for this hint, but I still get this grafical bug where you can just see the lower left third of the screen...

Can you please post your settings?

using my Nvidia control panel i have forced on vsync and triple buffering, AA is on override application, 8x, other than that, i used the ksp launcher to set it to run in frameless window mode, also disabled the AA in ksp as i am forcing it through the Nvidia control panel. When the game is loading up, press alt+enter and it should change it into windowed mode, which solves this problem for me. Hope this helps.

i used the ksp launcher to set it to run in frameless window mode

not sure if I get this right...

Are you refering to "-popupwindow" in the Steam Launch options?

No, sorry, not using it through steam I copied a stock file of ksp and put it on my ssd. Inside the ksp folder there is a launcher.exe file, when you use that, in the options under the advanced tab the option is there.

No, sorry, not using it through steam I copied a stock file of ksp and put it on my ssd. Inside the ksp folder there is a launcher.exe file, when you use that, in the options under the advanced tab the option is there.

Which is exactly the same as the Steam launch options. (Steam just launches the game with the command line arguments specified in the launch options, the same as just making a shortcut or using advanced options in Windows.)
